Compulsion.origin: [a payment exacted by lawless "E. A. Farnsworth and W. F. Young"]

1.definition: an act of compelling (as by threat or intimidation)[a payment exacted by lawless "E. A. Farnsworth and W. F. Young"]

2.note: Compulsion can make a contract voidable or be a ground for damages or restitution. Compulsion may also be a defense to a criminal act.
